content.question: A <math alttext="0.1 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> aqueous solution of which of the acids shown in the table above would have a <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> closest to <math alttext="7.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>l</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has the highest electronegativity.

<math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>B</mtext><mtext>r</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="B r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext><mtext>r</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has the lowest electronegativity.

<math alttext="H I O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="I " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ι</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has the lowest electronegativity.
All three solutions will have the same <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because they are all monoprotic acids.

content.answer: <math alttext="H I O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, because <math alttext="I " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Ι</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has the lowest electronegativity.

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
